content.en: Enhancing Breast Mass Diagnosis: Researchers are investigating the use of computer algorithms to improve the accuracy of diagnosing breast masses. These algorithms, such as custom-designed classifiers and newly developed ones, are being tested to see if they can better distinguish between malignant and benign masses on ultrasound images. Other studies are exploring the effectiveness of automated systems, like automated breast volume scanning and automated breast ultrasound, in detecting and classifying breast lesions. The goal is to utilize the information from radiologists and improve the diagnostic performance of these algorithms, ultimately reducing false-positive diagnoses and unnecessary biopsies.
content.da: Forbedring af brystmasse-diagnose: Forskere undersøger brugen af computeralgoritmer til at forbedre nøjagtigheden af diagnoser af brystmasser. Disse algoritmer, såsom skræddersyede klassifikatorer og nyudviklede, testes for at se, om de bedre kan skelne mellem maligne og benigne masser på ultralydsbilleder. Andre studier undersøger effektiviteten af automatiserede systemer, såsom automatiseret brystvolumenskanning og automatiseret brystultralyd, til at opdage og klassificere brystlæsioner. Målet er at udnytte oplysningerne fra radiologer og forbedre den diagnostiske præstation af disse algoritmer, hvilket i sidste ende reducerer falsk-positive diagnoser og unødvendige biopsier.
